body: We could add an overload for `execute` that returns a `Future` (so you can cancel asynchronous executions) and takes an `EngineExecutionListener` as an additional argument.
Tentatively slated for 5.7 M1 solely for the purpose of _team discussion_.

issue.title: Report features as "container and test" when unrolling iterations and set status according to iterations

repository.name: spock
repository.description: The Enterprise-ready testing and specification framework.

issue.title: Default unroll and rollup

repository.name: spock
repository.description: The Enterprise-ready testing and specification framework.

issue.body: Here a first draft of the finished default unrolling and explicit rolling. Draft because of the hacky reflection listener manipulation that works around the missing junit-team/junit5#2188 implementation. Besides that, this PR is already reviewable and it actually works fine, but only look at the last commit. The others are just my other two PRs merged together as parent, as otherwise there would be too many conflicts for no headache. :-) --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/spockframework/spock/1101)

issue.title: Allow using DynamicTestExecutor with custom listener

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ✅ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
- Add `Node.DynamicTestExecutor#execute(TestDescriptor,
  EngineExecutionListener)` for engines that wish to pass a custom
  `EngineExecutionListener` and cancel or wait for the execution of a
  submitted test via the returned `Future`.
- Add `EngineExecutionListener.NOOP` and change all declared methods to
  have empty default implementations.

Resolves #2188.

---

### Definition of Done

- [x] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [x] Method [preconditions](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [x] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass
